name: Thriftbook
tagline: Source for the examples in the Programmer's Guide to Apache Thrift
body:
### Welcome to the Source Repo for The Programmer's Guide to Apache Thrift
The Programmer's Guide to Apache Thrift is a new book from [Manning Publications](http://www.manning.com/abernethy/). The book is currently in early access (MEAP) with all chapters available electronically. The Apache Thrift example code in this repository is covered in detail in the book. To acquire a copy of the source, simply clone this repository:

```
$ cd path/where/you/want/the/source
$ git clone https://github.com/RandyAbernethy/ThriftBook
```

### Working with the Source
Apache Thrift is a cross language RPC framework, perfectly suited to the task of creating high performance microservices. The source code in this repo covers a range of languages and each will have its own prerequisites, as described in the book. The code examples generally require Apache Thrift v0.9.2 at a minimum. Thrift can be found [here](https://thrift.apache.org/).

### Author
This source and the book were written by @RandyAbernethy.

### Support 
Support for the book and its sources are available through [Manning Author Online](http://www.manning-sandbox.com/forum.jspa?forumID=873).
